meanings.definition: Having less fat or flesh than is usual or desirable.
meanings.sent1: The cat looked skinnier after being on a diet.
meanings.sent2: She wanted to be skinnier, so she started exercising more.
meanings.sent3: The skinnier squirrel won the race to the acorns.
meanings.sent4: His wallet felt skinnier after buying the expensive watch.
meanings.sent5: The skinnier branches of the tree swayed in the wind.

meanings.definition: A comparative form of the adjective 'skinny'.
meanings.sent1: She was always the skinnier of the two sisters.
meanings.sent2: The skinnier in the group was chosen to model the new clothes.
meanings.sent3: The skinnier at the party won the dance competition.
meanings.sent4: He was proud to be the skinnier in his class.
meanings.sent5: The skinnier of the twins had a different style.

meanings.definition: To become thinner or more slender.
meanings.sent1: She hoped to skinnier before her wedding day.
meanings.sent2: He worked hard to skinnier for the upcoming marathon.
meanings.sent3: The caterpillar began to skinnier as it transformed into a butterfly.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to skinnier as it flowed downstream.
meanings.sent5: The population of the town started to skinnier as people moved away.
